Title: This Secret is Staying With Me! Ep.2
SubTitle: No Translation

Text: ...There it is.

From a distance, it seems like there are some people
around the ruins, but not too many.

There are no signs that they're moving anything out.
I don't think this site is special anyway.
I wonder what's up with this place...

If an artifact has been discovered, it's normal for
there to be traces of magic. But the magic here
is...weak.

Even if my ability to sense magic was poor, it's not
so bad that I wouldn't be able to sense anything in
these ruins.

No one would ever bat an eye at ruins like these.
I'm clueless as to what the Cult of Diablos would
want with a place like this.

...I can't worry about their intentions for now.
I need to find out what happened to the Shadow
Garden unit that we lost contact with.

Well...I have to get inside the ruins. It's a bit
concerning that I don't know what's going
on insideâ€”

I guess I shouldn't say that since I don't know if
the unit is safe or not.

As Epsilon enters the ruins, she finds herself on
a long, dark, and gloomy road.

It's discouraging how few people there are. I wonder
where everyone I saw earlier went.

I can't believe there's enough of a threat here to
destroy a Shadow Garden unit. That's my
immediate concern.

No matter how inexperienced they were, it's absurd
that soldiers trained by Lambda could be defeated
easily. Their opponent was Named Class, right...?
Huh? A breeze...? And...is that the smell of blood?!

A gentle breeze drifts through the ruins, and the
smell of blood, though faint, lingers in the air.
...It's coming from the other side.

Epsilon moves forward while watching all directions
with caution. No real threat is nearby, but the smell
of blood becomes stronger with each step.

(Is there something up ahead...? Why don't I feel
any magic?)

(Completely eliminating magic and its presence...
The only person I know who can do that is Master
Shadow...)

An enemy with powers to rival Master Shadow...?
No way.

There's no one in this universe as capable as
Master Shadow.

Master Shadow is infallible. There's no way that
anyone could ever reach his level.

She tries to persuade herself repeatedly, feeling
a cold sweat trickling down her back as she
imagines someone sneaking up on her.
(The smell of blood is getting stronger...!)

Three bloodied bodies lay before her, explaining the
strong metallic odor.
Hang in there! What the heck happened here?!

Rushing over to the bodies, she realizes she is too
late. There is no response from any of them.
All of them...are dead.

This must be the Shadow Garden unit that we lost
contact with.

It looks like they were struck from behind with a
massive blow... The three of them were beaten,
but...these aren't wounds inflicted by a sword
or spear.

The wounds are serrated and don't appear to have been
caused by a sharp blade.

These must be fang or claw wounds. Were they attacked
by some beast...? This isn't from Cult members...

This must've been a surprise attack... The first blow
basically stopped them from counterattacking...

Left speechless, she tries to imagine what kind of
horrific scene had transpired.

Units mutually support each other to reduce blind
spots. They should've been thoroughly trained by
Lambda to be competent in group combat.

Itâ€™s hard to imagine that a highly trained team would
be caught in a surprise attack from a beast.

An image of Delta flashes in her mind at the mention
of a "beast."

A beast is a beast, but is there a hybrid beast here with
fighting skills on par with Delta...?

But...it's unthinkable that a slime bodysuit could be
ripped open by a mere beast attack, even if it were
a fatal blow.
Butâ€”

What's up with the slime suits they are wearing?
It looks like the suits melted off.

The slime couldn't maintain its form as a suit...?
Jeez! I have more questions than answers at
this point.

They were beaten so badly, and the slime suits they
relied on turned out to be completely useless as
protective gear.
What's going on in these ruins...?

It's a different type of mission than usual, and I
don't know who the enemy is. What am I going
to do?

I haven't been this shaken since I was little.
I can feel my emotions clouding my judgement.

*sigh* I thought I've made progress since then.
I guess I'm still not there yet...

Still, I can't disappoint Lady Alpha, or Master Shadow,
who specifically chose me for this mission.

If you don't know who the enemy is, you just have to
find out. Though it won't be easy.
But...

Every step she takes is heavy, feeling like her
feet are full of lead.

Not only my legs...but my entire body has felt heavy
for a while now... What the...?
Her stride is sluggish.

Since I entered this corner...my body has been
getting weaker and weaker. What's going on...?

At that moment, she gets a chill. She feels a clear
and impeding intent to killâ€”
